revised_title: Max Planck: A Tribute by Sir Charles Darwin
tldr: This address by Sir Charles Darwin pays tribute to the memory of Max Planck, the originator of the quantum theory. The Royal Society honored Planck with the Copley Medal in 1929 and celebrated his contributions to science. Planck's character is remembered as modest, kindly, and blameless, and his legacy will endure in the study of science.
